articles.title: Book praising Secy. Kim Jong Il published in  Russia
articles.content:
Book praising Secy. Kim Jong Il published in  Russia
   Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- The Paleya Publishing House 
of Russia printed the book "Leader of the 21st Century -- 
Kim Jong Il" on the occasion of the 55th birthday of Secretary Kim Jong Il.
   The book containing articles written by the chief editor 
and the first subeditor of the newspaper patriot is made up 
of seven chapters including "Heroic People", "General", "the 
Greatest Man", "Mysterious Might of Kimjongilia" and "the 
Man Embracing the Whole World".
   It carries voices of the world's progressive people 
praising Secretary Kim Jong Il as the beacon of hope and the 
banner of victorious socialism and features distinguished 
exploits he has performed in army building through 
inspections of units of the Korean People's Army.
   It also introduces his revolutionary family and his 
traits and human love.

articles.title: S. Korean students demonstrate
articles.content:
S. Korean students demonstrate
  Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Some 250 students belonging 
to the Kwangju and south Jolla provincial federation of 
university student councils on Thursday urged a 
thorough investigation into the Hanbo incident, Seoul-based 
radio no.1 reported.
   They thronged to Kwangju and south Jolla provincial 
offices of the "New Korea Party" and staged a demonstration, 
accusing the puppet authorities of avoiding a close 
investigation of the hanbo incident and Kim Hyon Chol and 
urging the introduction of a special prosecutor system for 
an impartial investigation.
   The riot police fired barrages of tear gas at them, but 
they continued the demonstration undauntedly.

articles.title: 41st National Day of Tunisia celebrated
articles.content:
41st National Day of Tunisia celebrated
   Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- A meeting to mark the 41st 
anniversary of the Tunisian National Day was held in 
Pyongyang on Thursday in the name of the Korea-Tunisia 
friendship association.
   Present at the meeting were Ri Song Ho, Vice-chairman of 
the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign 
Countries and Chairman of the Korea-Tunisia friendship 
association, and  officials concerned as well as working 
people in the captial.
   A speech was made and a congratulatory message to the 
Tunisian President adopted at the meeting.

articles.title: Preparations for 85th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung abroad
articles.content:
Preparations for 85th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung abroad
   Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Preparatory committees for 
commemorating the 85th birth anniversary of the great leader 
President Kim Il Sung were inaugurated in Zimbabwe and Mali.
   Chairman N. T. Mawema of the Zimbabwe National Committee 
for the Study of the Juche Idea was elected Chairman of the 
Zimbabwe preparatory committee at an inaugural meeting. 
   The period from Mmar. 15 to April 15 was set as a month of 
commemoration and a colorful function program in this period 
was discussed at the meeting.
   Ibrahima n'diaye, Secretary General of the Executive 
Committee of the African Party of the Solidarity and Justice 
of Mali was elected chairman of the Mali preparatory 
committee.

articles.title: S. korean Sam Mi Steel works goes bankrupt
articles.content:
S. korean Sam Mi Steel works goes bankrupt
   Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- The Sam Mi Special Steel 
works under the Sam Mi group, one of the comprador 
businesses, went bankrupt on Mar. 19, failing to cash a bill 
of 1,119 million won, according to a Seoul-based radio 
report.
   This has put five other companies under the group on the 
verge of bankruptcy one after another.
   The group is in the crisis of overall bankruptcy, falling 
in debt amounting to 1,500 billion won. 
   The bankruptcy of the group idled hundreds of minor 
enterprises.
   The south korean economy is facing a more serious 
catastrophe with the bankruptcy of the Sam Mi group plus the 
Hanbo incident.

articles.title: Party given by Russian ambassador
articles.content:
Party given by Russian ambassador 
   Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Valeri Denisov, Russian 
ambassador to the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, 
hosted a party at the embassy here Thursday evening on the 
occasion of the 48th anniversary of the conclusion of the 
agreement on economic and cultural cooperation between the 
dprk and the Russian Federation.
   Invited to the party were Chairman of the State External 
Economic Affairs Commission Ri Song Dae, Vice Foreign 
Minister Ri In Gyu, Vice-chairman of the Radio and TV 
Broadcasting Committee of the DPRK Ro Sok Gyu, who is the 
chairman of the Korea-Russia friendship association, and 
other officials concerned. Speeches were made there.

articles.title: Korean people's struggle supported by Nigeria
articles.content:
Korean people's struggle supported by Nigeria 
  Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Nigeria's full support to 
the Korean people's just cause was expressed in Abuja on 
March 18.
   Nigeria expressed full support and solidarity for efforts 
of the DPRK government and people to reunify the country in 
a peaceful way on the three principles of independence, 
peaceful reunification and great national unity, according 
to a communique on the visit of the DPRK government 
delegation led by Vice-Premier and Foreign Minister 
Kim Yong Nam to Nigeria.  the communique said:
   The Nigerian side supported the Korean people who defend 
national independence and sovereignty and advance along the 
road of socialism chosen by themselves under the wise 
leadership of his excellency  Kim Jong Il.
   The Korean side expressed support for the Nigerian 
government in its plan to transfer power to civil government 
under the wise guidance of General Sani Abacha and in the 
efforts to solve disputes in africa in a peaceful way, 
strengthening regional cooperation.
   Views on the relations between the two countries, 
international issues and the nonaligned movement were 
exchanged at talks held between the Korean and Nigerian 
government delegations on March 17.

articles.title: S. Korean "ANSP's" moves condemned
articles.content:
S. Korean "ANSP's" moves condemned 
   Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Some local university 
student councils in South korea recently seceded from the 
federation of university student councils. It is a drama 
directed by the "Agency for National Security Planning" 
(ANSP) behind the scenes in an insidious intention to 
disintegrate the federation with the approach of the 
inaugural ceremony of its fifth-term organisation.
   The Korean student committee in the north said this in a 
statement thursday accusing the "ANSP" of its vicious behind-
the-scenes operation. The statement went on to say:
   The federation is an invincible patriotic unit whose one 
million members are struggling to open the road of 
independence, democracy and reunification, rallied as one 
with the support of the 70 million fellow countrymen. Its 
cause is just and no force can break the ranks.
   The traitor Kim Young Sam should promptly stop this 
operation of the "ANSP", unconditionally abrogate the 
retrogressively revised "law on the ansp" and dismantle this 
notorious "agency" at once.
   The committee expressed firm belief that students in the 
south  will sharpen their vigilance over the cunning moves 
of the Kim Young Sam group and reliably defend their 
dignified organization.

articles.title: CPRF Secretariat condemns campaign of south korean puppets against DPRK
articles.content:
CPRF Secretariat condemns campaign of south korean puppets against DPRK 
   Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- The Secretariat of the 
Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of the Fatherland 
in its information no. 732 on March 19 denounced the south 
korean puppets for planning to increase the fascist 
repressive apparatuses and viciously intensify the 
suppression of the patriotic  students and people  and the 
confrontation racket against the DPRK.
  A few days ago the puppet national police agency decided 
to establish or increase investigation organizations for 
"security" such as "investigation group" and "investigation 
team" in the headquarters of the police agency and local 
police offices and stations in south korea. And they also 
decided to reinforce the guard forces in the west coast and 
other major coastal areas to cope with "provocation" of the 
north.
   The information brands this as aimed at strengthening the 
fascist suppression of the south korean students and people 
calling for independence, democracy and reunification  and 
at aggravating the north-south confrontation under the 
pretext of "security". This shows the Kim Young Sam regime 
is a group of separatists and fascists, it said, and went 
on:
   "We will not remain an onlooker to the south korean 
puppets' reckless fascist repression and anti-DPRK campaign."

articles.title: Press review
articles.content:
Press review 
   Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Papers here today 
frontpage a report that the great leader Secretary Kim Jong Il 
sent gifts to Kim Il Sung University and schools for 
bereaved children.
   Secretary Kim Jong Il, Supreme Commander of the Korean 
People's Army, sent thanks to units, officials, working 
people and students for having sincerely helped servicemen 
in the building of major objects, says Rodong Sinmun.
   Preparatory committees were formed in Mali and Zimbabwe 
to commemorate the 85th birth anniversary of the great 
leader President Kim Il Sung, says the press.
   Minju Joson devotes two pages to an article and 
photographs on the results of mt. Paektu exploration made 
in recent years.
   Econews of the press includes innovations effected in 
production in various domains of the national economy to 
finish the "arduous march" victoriously this year and seed 
sowing which began in rural communities in lowlands of the 
west coast.
   Papers inform the readers of the sojourn in nigeria of 
a dprk government delegation led by Vice-Premier and Foreign 
Minister Kim Yong Nam.
   Carried in the press is a statement of the Korean Student 
Committee denouncing the south korean puppet Agency for 
National Security Planning for its moves to divide and 
disintegrate the South Korean Federation of University 
Student Councils.
   Broad segments of the south korean people are strongly 
calling for a strict investigation into the hanbo corruption 
scandal and Kim Hyon Chol, says the press.
   Rodong Sinmun in an article denounces the traitor Kim 
Young Sam for his racket over the fictitious "threat from 
the north".
   The paper in a commentary charges that the United States 
continues resorting to war provocation moves against the 
northern half of Korea in league with the south korean 
puppets behind the facade of suspension of the "Team Spirit" 
joint military manoeuvres.
   The paper in an article says that the large warship 
"Osumi" set afloat in Japan some time ago is a product of 
the wild ambition for overseas expansion.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on double-faced behaviour of the United  States
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on double-faced behaviour of the United  States 
   Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- The United States is 
continuing war preparations against the Democratic People's 
Republic of Korea on the plea of "nuclear and missile threat 
from the DPRK" together with the south korean puppets even 
after it announced that it decided not to stage "Team 
Spirit" joint manoeuvres this year.
   Commenting on this, a news analyst of Rodong Sinmun today 
says:
   The U.S. intensified war preparations are inconsistent 
with its commitment.
   The DPRK and the United States are technically in a state 
of war. Accordingly,  any military action taken in such a 
state will provoke the dprk and result in keying up tensions 
on the Korean peninsula.
   If the United States truly wants the relaxation of 
tensions on the Korean peninsula, it must stop not only the 
"Team Spirit" but also all other war provocation moves.
   The Korean People's Army and people are compelled to take 
full readiness to cope with military moves of the United 
States and the south korean puppets because they are 
aggravating the situation on the Korean peninsula. 
   When a war breaks out in Korea, the DPRK will 
lose nothing but the Military Demarcation Line.
   The korean people and army are following the behaviour of 
the United States.

articles.title: Great man and natural phenomena
articles.content:
Great man and natural phenomena
   Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- A new legend is these days 
gaining circulation in korea, stirring up the hearts of 
people. it says, "the Snowstorm of mt. Paektu Fell in Fog".
   A legendary phenomenon occured on November 24 last year 
when the respected General Kim Jong Il, the son of mt. 
Paektu and a peerlessly great man,  was giving on-site 
guidance to the Panmunjom mission of the Korean People's 
Army, an outpost of the forefront.
   That day, the area of Panmunjom was enveloped in thick 
fog from dawn. In the previous days, it had been cloudy but 
fog never set in in the area. 
   The General went round various places of Panmunjom and 
mounted the balcony of the Panmun House to acquaint himself 
with the enemy situation.
   The fog would not go while he was making an inspection 
tour of the area.
   So, the enemy failed to observe the kpa post and, 
accordingly, they could not take any hint of happenings 
there.
   Mysterious is the fact that the fog began to lift 
suddenly and the weather cleared when the general posed for 
a photograph in front of the monument dedicated to an 
autograph signature of the great leader President 
Kim Il Sung.
   The fog disappeared after the General ended his 
inspection of Panmunjom.
   It was when he inspected the KPA Post on mt. Taedok in 
the western sector of the front on March 18 last year.
   No sooner had his car arrived at the entrance to the post 
within the range of the enemy observation than its sky was 
covered with inky clouds.
   Instantly the car passed by, the sky began to clear up.
   a mysterious natural phenomenon took place at a time when 
the General was inspecting a kpa unit which is defending cho 
island in the West Sea.
   After mounting a forward command post, exposed to rain 
and wind, he stood by a map of operations when the black 
rain cloud cleared and bright sunrays spread.
   Such a natural phenomenon happened when he posed for a 
photograph with sailors at a naval unit on that same day. 
   Informed of them, people say that even the heaven ensures 
the personal safety of General Kim Jong Il, working 
mysterious wonders.

articles.title: Greetings to Chairman of Funcinpec Party
articles.content:
Greetings to Chairman of Funcinpec Party
  Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of 
the Workers' Party of Korea sent a message of greetings 
Thursday to Norodom Ranariddh, Chairman of the Funcinpec 
Party, on the occasion of the 16th anniversary of its 
foundation.
   The message noted that the Funcinpec Party has achieved 
success in the efforts to realise the reconciliation and 
unity of the whole nation and to push ahead with the cause 
of reconstruction of the country upholding the intention of 
his majesty King Norodom Sihanouk.
   The message expressed the belief that the traditional 
relations of friendship and cooperation between the parties 
and peoples of the two countries will be strengthened, and 
wished the funcinpec party and the cambodian people greater 
success in their struggle for building a new Cambodia.

articles.title: Greetings to Nepali Prime Minister
articles.content:
Greetings to Nepali Prime Minister
   Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Hong Song Nam, acting 
Premier of the Administration Council of the Democratic 
People's Republic of Korea, sent a message of greetings to 
Lokendra Bahadur Chand, upon his appointment as Prime 
Minister of Nepal.
   The message expressed the belief that the friendly and 
cooperative relations between the two countries will be 
further strengthened and developed in the idea of 
independence, peace and friendship.
